trans-unit.source: mssql object
trans-unit.target: mssql object

trans-unit.source: Enables direct use of Transact-SQL code for working with tables in the <token>SQLAzDb</token>.
trans-unit.target: Enables direct use of Transact-SQL code for working with tables in the <token>SQLAzDb</token>.

trans-unit.source: Can be used in all varieties of server scripts:
trans-unit.target: Can be used in all varieties of server scripts:

trans-unit.source: table operation scripts like <legacyItalic>insert</legacyItalic>, <legacyItalic>update</legacyItalic>, <legacyItalic>read</legacyItalic>, and <legacyItalic>del</legacyItalic>;
trans-unit.target: table operation scripts like <legacyItalic>insert</legacyItalic>, <legacyItalic>update</legacyItalic>, <legacyItalic>read</legacyItalic>, and <legacyItalic>del</legacyItalic>;

trans-unit.source: Scheduler scripts; and
trans-unit.target: Scheduler scripts; and

trans-unit.source: Custom APIs.
trans-unit.target: Custom APIs.

trans-unit.source: For more detailed discussion and information see the <legacyBold>Using Transact-SQL to access tables</legacyBold> section in <externalLink><linkText>Work with server scripts in Mobile Services</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/develop/mobile/how-to-guides/work-with-server-scripts/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more detailed discussion and information see the <legacyBold>Using Transact-SQL to access tables</legacyBold> section in <externalLink><linkText>Work with server scripts in Mobile Services</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/develop/mobile/how-to-guides/work-with-server-scripts/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Methods
trans-unit.target: Methods

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>mssql</languageKeyword> object has the following methods:
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>mssql</languageKeyword> object has the following methods:

trans-unit.source: query
trans-unit.target: query

trans-unit.source: queryRaw
trans-unit.target: queryRaw

trans-unit.source: open
trans-unit.target: open

trans-unit.source: query
trans-unit.target: query

trans-unit.source: Executes a query, specified by a TSQL string; the results are returned to the <legacyBold>success</legacyBold> callback on the <parameterReference>options</parameterReference> object.
trans-unit.target: Executes a query, specified by a TSQL string; the results are returned to the <legacyBold>success</legacyBold> callback on the <parameterReference>options</parameterReference> object.

trans-unit.source: The query can include parameters if the <parameterReference>params</parameterReference> parameter is present.
trans-unit.target: The query can include parameters if the <parameterReference>params</parameterReference> parameter is present.

trans-unit.source: Syntax
trans-unit.target: Syntax

trans-unit.source: Parameters
trans-unit.target: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: The TSQL string to execute.
trans-unit.target: The TSQL string to execute.

trans-unit.source: The <placeholder>?</placeholder> placeholders, if present, are replaced with the contents of the <parameterReference>params</parameterReference> array.
trans-unit.target: The <placeholder>?</placeholder> placeholders, if present, are replaced with the contents of the <parameterReference>params</parameterReference> array.

trans-unit.source: Replace the <placeholder>?</placeholder> placeholders in the <parameterReference>sql</parameterReference> string.
trans-unit.target: Replace the <placeholder>?</placeholder> placeholders in the <parameterReference>sql</parameterReference> string.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>success</legacyBold> and optionally <legacyBold>error</legacyBold> callback functions (see remarks for details).
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>success</legacyBold> and optionally <legacyBold>error</legacyBold> callback functions (see remarks for details).

trans-unit.source: queryRaw
trans-unit.target: queryRaw

trans-unit.source: Executes a query, specified by a TSQL string; the results are returned to the <legacyBold>success</legacyBold> callback on the <parameterReference>options</parameterReference> object.
trans-unit.target: Executes a query, specified by a TSQL string; the results are returned to the <legacyBold>success</legacyBold> callback on the <parameterReference>options</parameterReference> object.

trans-unit.source: The query can include parameters if the <parameterReference>params</parameterReference> parameter is present.
trans-unit.target: The query can include parameters if the <parameterReference>params</parameterReference> parameter is present.

trans-unit.source: The returned results are in <legacyItalic>raw</legacyItalic> format.
trans-unit.target: The returned results are in <legacyItalic>raw</legacyItalic> format.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyItalic>raw</legacyItalic> format is a JSON format that consists of a <legacyBold>metadata</legacyBold> section which describes the result set’s columns, followed by a <legacyBold>rows</legacyBold> section which contains multiple row elements, each of which has one entry for each column in the result set.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyItalic>raw</legacyItalic> format is a JSON format that consists of a <legacyBold>metadata</legacyBold> section which describes the result set’s columns, followed by a <legacyBold>rows</legacyBold> section which contains multiple row elements, each of which has one entry for each column in the result set.

trans-unit.source: For an example, see <externalLink><linkText>Work with server scripts in Mobile Services</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/develop/mobile/how-to-guides/work-with-server-scripts/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For an example, see <externalLink><linkText>Work with server scripts in Mobile Services</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/develop/mobile/how-to-guides/work-with-server-scripts/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.target: The TSQL string to execute.

trans-unit.source: The <placeholder>?</placeholder> placeholders, if present, are replaced with the contents of the <parameterReference>params</parameterReference> array.
trans-unit.target: The <placeholder>?</placeholder> placeholders, if present, are replaced with the contents of the <parameterReference>params</parameterReference> array.

trans-unit.source: Replace the <placeholder>?</placeholder> placeholders in the <parameterReference>sql</parameterReference> string.
trans-unit.target: Replace the <placeholder>?</placeholder> placeholders in the <parameterReference>sql</parameterReference> string.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>success</legacyBold> and optionally <legacyBold>error</legacyBold> callback functions (see remarks for details).
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>success</legacyBold> and optionally <legacyBold>error</legacyBold> callback functions (see remarks for details).

trans-unit.source: open
trans-unit.target: open

trans-unit.source: Opens a connection to the Mobile Services SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Opens a connection to the Mobile Services SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: The connection is returned as an argument to the <legacyBold>success</legacyBold> handler.
trans-unit.target: The connection is returned as an argument to the <legacyBold>success</legacyBold> handler.

trans-unit.source: You can then invoke the following functions on the <codeInline>connection</codeInline> object: <legacyItalic>close</legacyItalic>, <legacyItalic>queryRaw</legacyItalic>, <legacyItalic>query</legacyItalic>, <legacyItalic>beginTransaction</legacyItalic>, <legacyItalic>commit</legacyItalic>, and <legacyItalic>rollback</legacyItalic>
trans-unit.target: You can then invoke the following functions on the <codeInline>connection</codeInline> object: <legacyItalic>close</legacyItalic>, <legacyItalic>queryRaw</legacyItalic>, <legacyItalic>query</legacyItalic>, <legacyItalic>beginTransaction</legacyItalic>, <legacyItalic>commit</legacyItalic>, and <legacyItalic>rollback</legacyItalic>

trans-unit.target: Syntax

trans-unit.target: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>success</legacyBold> and optionally <legacyBold>error</legacyBold> callback functions (see remarks for details).
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>success</legacyBold> and optionally <legacyBold>error</legacyBold> callback functions (see remarks for details).

trans-unit.source: options parameter
trans-unit.target: options parameter

trans-unit.source: Syntax
trans-unit.target: Syntax

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: { success: function(results) {…..}, error: function() { …
trans-unit.target: { success: function(results) {…..}, error: function() { …

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>success</legacyBold> function provides access to the results of the operation on the SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>success</legacyBold> function provides access to the results of the operation on the SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>error</legacyBold> function is optional.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>error</legacyBold> function is optional.

trans-unit.source: All three methods of this object use the <legacyBold>options</legacyBold> parameter, which consists of two call-back functions: a <legacyBold>success</legacyBold> function, and an optional <legacyBold>error</legacyBold> function.
trans-unit.target: All three methods of this object use the <legacyBold>options</legacyBold> parameter, which consists of two call-back functions: a <legacyBold>success</legacyBold> function, and an optional <legacyBold>error</legacyBold> function.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>success</legacyBold> function takes a <legacyBold>results</legacyBold> parameter: this function is where you can process the results of the SQL Database operation.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>success</legacyBold> function takes a <legacyBold>results</legacyBold> parameter: this function is where you can process the results of the SQL Database operation.

trans-unit.source: The optional <legacyBold>error</legacyBold> function is used for error recovery beyond the default level already provided by Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: The optional <legacyBold>error</legacyBold> function is used for error recovery beyond the default level already provided by Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Failures can occur when there is a loss of connectivity to the database, an invalid object, or an incorrect query.
trans-unit.target: Failures can occur when there is a loss of connectivity to the database, an invalid object, or an incorrect query.

trans-unit.source: By default when an error occurs, server scripts log the error and write an error result to the response.
trans-unit.target: By default when an error occurs, server scripts log the error and write an error result to the response.

trans-unit.source: Because Mobile Services provides default error handling, you don't have to handle errors that may occur in the service.
trans-unit.target: Because Mobile Services provides default error handling, you don't have to handle errors that may occur in the service.

trans-unit.source: You can override the default error handling by implementing explicit error handling if you want a particular compensating action or when you want to use the global console object to write more detailed information to the log.
trans-unit.target: You can override the default error handling by implementing explicit error handling if you want a particular compensating action or when you want to use the global console object to write more detailed information to the log.

trans-unit.source: For more information see <externalLink><linkText>Work with server scripts in Mobile Services</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/develop/mobile/how-to-guides/work-with-server-scripts/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information see <externalLink><linkText>Work with server scripts in Mobile Services</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/develop/mobile/how-to-guides/work-with-server-scripts/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The following query can be part of any variety of server script.
trans-unit.target: The following query can be part of any variety of server script.

trans-unit.source: It has no parameters and returns three records from the <codeInline>statusupdate</codeInline> table in the <parameterReference>results</parameterReference> parameter of the <codeInline>success</codeInline> function.
trans-unit.target: It has no parameters and returns three records from the <codeInline>statusupdate</codeInline> table in the <parameterReference>results</parameterReference> parameter of the <codeInline>success</codeInline> function.

trans-unit.source: The following example implements custom authorization in an insert script by reading permissions for the request user from the <codeInline>permissions</codeInline> table.
trans-unit.target: The following example implements custom authorization in an insert script by reading permissions for the request user from the <codeInline>permissions</codeInline> table.

trans-unit.source: When the query is executed, the placeholder <placeholder>?</placeholder> in the TSQL string is replaced with the supplied parameter, which is the <codeInline>userID</codeInline> field of the incoming <legacyBold>user</legacyBold> parameter.
trans-unit.target: When the query is executed, the placeholder <placeholder>?</placeholder> in the TSQL string is replaced with the supplied parameter, which is the <codeInline>userID</codeInline> field of the incoming <legacyBold>user</legacyBold> parameter.
